verses.verse: Then <WG2532> came together <WG4863> <WG5743> unto <WG4314> him <WG846> the P'rushim <WG5330>, and <WG2532> certain <WG5100> of the scribes <WG1122>, which came <WG2064> <WG5631> from <WG575> Yerushalayim <WG2414>.

And <WG2532> when they saw <WG1492> <WG5631> some <WG5100> of his <WG846> Talmidim <WG3101> eat <WG2068> <WG5723> bread <WG740> with defiled <WG2839>, that is to say <WG5123> <WG5748>, with unwashen <WG449>, hands <WG5495>, they found fault <WG3201> <WG5662>.

For <WG1063> the P'rushim <WG5330>, and <WG2532> all <WG3956> the Jews <WG2453>, except <WG3362> they wash <WG3538> <WG5672> their hands <WG5495> oft <WG4435>, eat <WG2068> <WG5719> not <WG3756>, holding <WG2902> <WG5723> the tradition <WG3862> of the elders <WG4245>.

And <WG2532> when they come from <WG575> the market <WG58>, except <WG3362> they wash <WG907> <WG5672>, they eat <WG2068> <WG5719> not <WG3756>. And <WG2532> many <WG4183> other things <WG243> there be <WG2076> <WG5748>, which <WG3739> they have received <WG3880> <WG5627> to hold <WG2902> <WG5721>, as the washing <WG909> of cups <WG4221>, and <WG2532> pots <WG3582>, <WG2532> brasen vessels <WG5473>, and <WG2532> of tables <WG2825>.

Then <WG1899> the P'rushim <WG5330> and <WG2532> scribes <WG1122> asked <WG1905> <WG5719> him <WG846>, Why <WG1302> walk <WG4043> <WG5719> not <WG3756> thy <WG4675> Talmidim <WG3101> according <WG2596> to the tradition <WG3862> of the elders <WG4245>, but <WG235> eat <WG2068> <WG5719> bread <WG740> with unwashen <WG449> hands <WG5495>?

He answered <WG611> <WG5679> and <WG1161> said <WG2036> <WG5627> unto them <WG846>, <WG3754> Well <WG2573> hath Esaias <WG2268> prophesied <WG4395> <WG5656> of <WG4012> you <WG5216> hypocrites <WG5273>, as <WG5613> it is written <WG1125> <WG5769>, This <WG3778> people <WG2992> honoureth <WG5091> <WG5719> me <WG3165> with their lips <WG5491>, but <WG1161> their <WG846> heart <WG2588> is <WG568> <WG5719> far <WG4206> from <WG575> me <WG1700>.
Howbeit <WG1161> in vain <WG3155> do they worship <WG4576> <WG5736> me <WG3165>, teaching <WG1321> <WG5723> for doctrines <WG1319> the Mitzvot <WG1778> of men <WG444>.

For <WG1063> laying aside <WG863> <WG5631> the Mitzvah <WG1785> of 'Elohim <WG2316>, ye hold <WG2902> <WG5719> the tradition <WG3862> of men <WG444>, as the washing <WG909> of pots <WG3582> and <WG2532> cups <WG4221>: and <WG2532> many <WG4183> other <WG243> such <WG5108> like things <WG3946> ye do <WG4160> <WG5719>.

And <WG2532> he said <WG3004> <WG5707> unto them <WG846>, Full well <WG2573> ye reject <WG114> <WG5719> the Mitzvah <WG1785> of 'Elohim <WG2316>, that <WG2443> ye may keep <WG5083> <WG5661> your own <WG5216> tradition <WG3862>.

For <WG1063> Mosheh <WG3475> said <WG2036> <WG5627>, Honour <WG5091> <WG5720> thy <WG4675> father <WG3962> and <WG2532> thy <WG4675> mother <WG3384>; and <WG2532>, Whoso curseht <WG2551> <WG5723> father <WG3962> or <WG2228> mother <WG3384>, let him die <WG5053> <WG5720> the death <WG2288>:

But <WG1161> ye <WG5210> say <WG3004> <WG5719>, If <WG1437> a man <WG444> shall say <WG2036> <WG5632> to his father <WG3962> or <WG2228> mother <WG3384>, It is Corban <WG2878>, that is to say <WG3603>, a gift <WG1435>, by <WG1537> whatsoever <WG3739> <WG1437> thou mightest be profited by <WG5623> <WG5686> me <WG1700>; he shall be free.
And <WG2532> ye suffer <WG863> <WG5719> him <WG846> no more <WG3765> to do <WG4160> <WG5658> ought <WG3762> for his <WG846> father <WG3962> or <WG2228> his <WG846> mother <WG3384>;

Making <WG208> the word <WG3056> of 'Elohim <WG2316> of none effect <WG208> <WG5723> through your <WG5216> tradition <WG3862>, which <WG3739> ye have delivered <WG3860> <WG5656>: and <WG2532> many <WG4183> such <WG5108> like things <WG3946> do ye <WG4160> <WG5719>.

And <WG2532> when he had called <WG4341> <WG5666> all <WG3956> the people <WG3793> unto him, he said <WG3004> <WG5707> unto them <WG846>, Hearken <WG191> <WG5720> unto me <WG3450> every one <WG3956> of you, and <WG2532> understand <WG4920> <WG5720>:

There is <WG2076> <WG5748> nothing <WG3762> from without <WG1855> a man <WG444>, that <WG3739> entering <WG1531> <WG5740> into <WG1519> him <WG846> can <WG1410> <WG5736> defile <WG2840> <WG5658> him <WG846>: but <WG235> the things which come <WG1607> <WG5740> out of <WG575> him <WG846>, those <WG1565> are they <WG2076> <WG5748> that defile <WG2840> <WG5723> the man <WG444>.
If any man <WG1536> have <WG2192> <WG5719> ears <WG3775> to hear <WG191> <WG5721>, let him hear <WG191> <WG5720>.

And <WG2532> when <WG3753> he was entered <WG1525> <WG5627> into <WG1519> the house <WG3624> from <WG575> the people <WG3793>, his <WG846> Talmidim <WG3101> asked <WG1905> <WG5707> him <WG846> concerning <WG4012> the parable <WG3850>.

And <WG2532> he saith <WG3004> <WG5719> unto them <WG846>, Are <WG2075> <WG5748> ye <WG5210> so <WG3779> without understanding <WG801> also <WG2532>? Do ye <WG3539> not <WG3756> perceive <WG3539> <WG5719>, that <WG3754> whatsoever thing <WG3956> from without <WG1855> entereth <WG1531> <WG5740> into <WG1519> the man <WG444>, it cannot <WG3756> <WG1410> <WG5736> defile <WG2840> <WG5658> him <WG846>;

Because <WG3754> it entereth <WG1531> <WG5736> not <WG3756> into <WG1519> his <WG846> heart <WG2588>, but <WG235> into <WG1519> the belly <WG2836>, and <WG2532> goeth out <WG1607> <WG5736> into <WG1519> the draught <WG856>, purging <WG2511> <WG5723> all <WG3956> meats <WG1033>?
And <WG1161> he said <WG3004> <WG5707>, <WG3754> That which cometh <WG1607> <WG5740> out of <WG1537> the man <WG444>, that <WG1565> defileth <WG2840> <WG5719> the man <WG444>.

For <WG1063> from within <WG2081>, out of <WG1537> the heart <WG2588> of men <WG444>, proceed <WG1607> <WG5736> evil <WG2556> thoughts <WG1261>, adulteries <WG3430>, fornications <WG4202>, murders <WG5408>,
Thefts <WG2829>, covetousness <WG4124>, wickedness <WG4189>, deceit <WG1388>, lasciviousness <WG766>, an evil <WG4190> eye <WG3788>, blasphemy <WG988>, pride <WG5243>, foolishness <WG877>:
All <WG3956> these <WG5023> evil things <WG4190> come <WG1607> <WG5736> from within <WG2081>, and <WG2532> defile <WG2840> <WG5719> the man <WG444>.

And <WG2532> from thence <WG1564> he arose <WG450> <WG5631>, and went <WG565> <WG5627> into <WG1519> the borders <WG3181> of TZor <WG5184> and <WG2532> TZidon <WG4605>, and <WG2532> entered <WG1525> <WG5631> into <WG1519> an house <WG3614>, and would have <WG2309> <WG5707> no man <WG3762> know <WG1097> <WG5629> it: but <WG2532> he could <WG1410> <WG5675> not <WG3756> be hid <WG2990> <WG5629>.

For <WG1063> a certain woman <WG1135>, whose <WG3739> <WG846> young daughter <WG2365> had <WG2192> <WG5707> an unclean <WG169> spirit <WG4151>, heard <WG191> <WG5660> of <WG4012> him <WG846>, and came <WG2064> <WG5631> and fell <WG4363> <WG5627> at <WG4314> his <WG846> feet <WG4228>:

<WG1161> The woman <WG1135> was <WG2258> <WG5713> a Greek <WG1674>, a Syrophenician <WG4949> by nation <WG1085>; and <WG2532> she besought <WG2065> <WG5707> him <WG846> that <WG2443> he would cast forth <WG1544> <WG5725> the devil <WG1140> out of <WG1537> her <WG846> daughter <WG2364>.

But <WG1161> Yeshuw`a <WG2424> said <WG2036> <WG5627> unto her <WG846>, Let <WG863> <WG5628> the children <WG5043> first <WG4412> be filled <WG5526> <WG5683>: for <WG1063> it is <WG2076> <WG5748> not <WG3756> meet <WG2570> to take <WG2983> <WG5629> the children's <WG5043> bread <WG740>, and <WG2532> to cast <WG906> <WG5629> it unto the dogs <WG2952>.

And <WG1161> she answered <WG611> <WG5662> and <WG2532> said <WG3004> <WG5719> unto him <WG846>, Yes <WG3483>, YY <WG2962>: yet <WG2532> <WG1063> the dogs <WG2952> under <WG5270> the table <WG5132> eat <WG2068> <WG5719> of <WG575> the children's <WG3813> crumbs <WG5589>.

And <WG2532> he said <WG2036> <WG5627> unto her <WG846>, For <WG1223> this <WG5126> saying <WG3056> go thy way <WG5217> <WG5720>; the devil <WG1140> is gone <WG1831> <WG5758> out of <WG1537> thy <WG4675> daughter <WG2364>.

And <WG2532> when she was come <WG565> <WG5631> to <WG1519> her <WG846> house <WG3624>, she found <WG2147> <WG5627> the devil <WG1140> gone out <WG1831> <WG5761>, and <WG2532> her daughter <WG2364> laid <WG906> <WG5772> upon <WG1909> the bed <WG2825>.

And <WG2532> again <WG3825>, departing <WG1831> <WG5631> from <WG1537> the coasts <WG3725> of TZor <WG5184> and <WG2532> TZidon <WG4605>, he came <WG2064> <WG5627> unto <WG4314> the sea <WG2281> of the Galil <WG1056>, through <WG303> the midst <WG3319> of the coasts <WG3725> of Decapolis <WG1179>.

And <WG2532> they bring <WG5342> <WG5719> unto him <WG846> one that was deaf <WG2974>, and had an impediment in his speech <WG3424>; and <WG2532> they beseech <WG3870> <WG5719> him <WG846> to <WG2443> put <WG2007> <WG5632> his hand <WG5495> upon him <WG846>.

And <WG2532> he took <WG618> <WG5642> him <WG846> aside <WG2596> <WG2398> from <WG575> the multitude <WG3793>, and put <WG906> <WG5627> his <WG846> fingers <WG1147> into <WG1519> his <WG846> ears <WG3775>, and <WG2532> he spit <WG4429> <WG5660>, and touched <WG680> <WG5662> his <WG846> tongue <WG1100>;

And <WG2532> looking up <WG308> <WG5660> to <WG1519> heaven <WG3772>, he sighed <WG4727> <WG5656>, and <WG2532> saith <WG3004> <WG5719> unto him <WG846>, Ephphatha <WG2188>, that is <WG3603>, Be opened <WG1272> <WG5682>.

And <WG2532> straightway <WG2112> his <WG846> ears <WG189> were opened <WG1272> <WG5681>, and <WG2532> the string <WG1199> of his <WG846> tongue <WG1100> was loosed <WG3089> <WG5681>, and <WG2532> he spake <WG2980> <WG5707> plain <WG3723>.

And <WG2532> he charged <WG1291> <WG5668> them <WG846> that <WG2443> they should tell <WG2036> <WG5632> no man <WG3367>: but <WG1161> the more <WG3745> he <WG846> charged <WG1291> <WG5710> them <WG846>, so much the more <WG3123> a great deal <WG4054> they published <WG2784> <WG5707> it;

And <WG2532> were beyond measure <WG5249> astonished <WG1605> <WG5712>, saying <WG3004> <WG5723>, He hath done <WG4160> <WG5758> all things <WG3956> well <WG2573>: he maketh <WG4160> <WG5719> both <WG2532> the deaf <WG2974> to hear <WG191> <WG5721>, and <WG2532> the dumb <WG216> to speak <WG2980> <WG5721>.
